com.vector.annotations.publishedapi

Annotation Type PublishedApi


  • @PublishedApi(value=CLASS_DEPENDENCY)
 @Documented
 @Retention(value=CLASS)
 @Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface PublishedApi
    The PublishedApi annotation indicates that the annotated type is part of an published API.
    The PublishedApi annotation indicates that the annotated type is part of an published API, which must not be changed in the development without an approval for changes! You have to mark all methods/fields in a type marked by this annotation with PublishedMethod/ PublishedField. The annotation needs a ChangePolicy to determine which change is a breaking change.
    • ChangePolicy.CHANGES_FORBIDDEN - Indicates that any change of the class is a breaking change!
    • ChangePolicy.ADDITIONS_ALLOWED - Indicates that only changes to existing elements of the class are breaking changes! Additions to the class are allowed, but lead to a minor API change.
    • ChangePolicy.CLASS_DEPENDENCY - Indicates that the class is only needed for compilation dependency. You this ChangePolicy with caution!

    To hide a method from the PublishedApi, you can annotate it with KeepSecretFromPublishedApi. This will prevent all client from the API to use this method. This feature is ensured during compile time of the client code. A change/deletion of KeepSecretFromPublishedApi methods are no changes of the PublishedApi.

    Every class could be additional annotated with PublishedApiDomain to limit the visibility of the class. For example a class with PublishedApiDomain DomainType.GENERATORS is only visible in the generators, not in the other domains.

    Usage example: 

     
 @PublishedApi(ChangePolicy.CHANGES_FORBIDDEN)
 @PublishedApiDomain({ DomainType.AUTOMATION_IF, DomainType.GENERATORS})
 public interface PublishedApi {

   @PublishedMethod
   void method();
 }

    The PublishedApi annotation shall not be used by clients using the published API. This is only for the export and tracking of the published API. So a client shall not annotate any class or interface with the PublishedApi annotation.

    (c) Copyright Vctr Informatik GmbH. All Rights Reserved.

    See Also:
    ChangePolicy, PublishedApiDomain

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      ChangePolicy value
      ChangePolicy for this class.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        @PublishedMethod
public abstract ChangePolicy value
        ChangePolicy for this class. This determines, if a change is a minor change or a breaking change.
        Returns:
        the change policy
